## PopulatedRedemption interface

A redemption transaction that has been prepared for sending.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface PopulatedRedemption<P = unknown, S = unknown, R = unknown> extends PopulatedGivetyTransaction<P, SentGivetyTransaction<S, GivetyReceipt<R, RedemptionDetails>>> 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [PopulatedGivetyTransaction](./lib-base.populatedgivetytransaction.md)<!-- -->&lt;P, [SentGivetyTransaction](./lib-base.sentgivetytransaction.md)<!-- -->&lt;S, [GivetyReceipt](./lib-base.givetyreceipt.md)<!-- -->&lt;R, [RedemptionDetails](./lib-base.redemptiondetails.md)<!-- -->&gt;&gt;&gt;

## Remarks

The Givety protocol fulfills redemptions by repaying the debt of Troves in ascending order of their collateralization ratio, and taking a portion of their collateral in exchange. Due to the [minimum debt](./lib-base.gusd_minimum_debt.md) requirement that Troves must fulfill, some GUSD amounts are not possible to redeem exactly.

When [redeemGUSD()](./lib-base.populatablegivety.redeemgusd.md) is called with an amount that can't be fully redeemed, the amount will be truncated (see the `redeemableGUSDAmount` property). When this happens, the redeemer can either redeem the truncated amount by sending the transaction unchanged, or prepare a new transaction by [increasing the amount](./lib-base.populatedredemption.increaseamountbyminimumnetdebt.md) to the next lowest possible value, which is the sum of the truncated amount and [GUSD\_MINIMUM\_NET\_DEBT](./lib-base.gusd_minimum_net_debt.md)<!-- -->.

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [attemptedGUSDAmount](./lib-base.populatedredemption.attemptedgusdamount.md) | [Decimal](./lib-base.decimal.md) | Amount of GUSD the redeemer is trying to redeem. |
|  [isTruncated](./lib-base.populatedredemption.istruncated.md) | boolean | Whether <code>redeemableGUSDAmount</code> is less than <code>attemptedGUSDAmount</code>. |
|  [redeemableGUSDAmount](./lib-base.populatedredemption.redeemablegusdamount.md) | [Decimal](./lib-base.decimal.md) | Maximum amount of GUSD that is currently redeemable from <code>attemptedGUSDAmount</code>. |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [increaseAmountByMinimumNetDebt(maxRedemptionRate)](./lib-base.populatedredemption.increaseamountbyminimumnetdebt.md) | Prepare a new transaction by increasing the attempted amount to the next lowest redeemable value. |
